newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Turnover on Romania OTC market up.
newsitem.headline: Turnover on Romania OTC market up.

text.p: Turnover on the Romanian over-the-counter (OTC) market was 2.03 trillion lei in the first week of trading in 1997, up from a weekly average of around 700 million last month, data by the RASDAQ trading system said.
A RASDAQ report on Friday put total OTC listings at 1,616.
The RASDAQ, which opened last October with six stocks and a first-week turnover of 9.0 million lei, is expected ultimately to trade shares in some 5,000 companies.

Under rules, companies privatised under the mass selloff have to sign up with the Romanian shareholders' registry (RRA) -- created to accommodate these companies -- and then get an OTC listing. ($1=4,238 lei)
